author: Special Correspondent
text:
A total of 44 tribal farmers, who attempted to picket the Collector’s Office here on Monday demanding the execution of the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court order to sanction free milch animals to them, courted arrest.

They were released later in the evening.

Though the Madurai Bench of the High Court had directed the district administration to issue free milch animals under the Tribal Development Programme on or before January 16, 2016, it was yet to be executed, said P. Ramasamy, secretary of the Tamil Nadu Hindu Malayali Scheduled Tribe Farmers Welfare Association, who led the tribal farmers.

He said that in all 78 farmers from Sengattupatti, Kambur, Thannerpallam, Keezhkarai, Sozhamathi, Puthur, Kundakadi, Karuvankadu, Boothakal, Oduvampatti, Periya Iluppur, Moolakadu and Kinathur on the Pachamalai, in September 2014, had been given sanction letters for milch animals but the Adi Dravidar Welfare Department did not take any step to distribute the animals.

Hence the farmers filed a petition. The High Court, in November last year, had given a directive to distribute the animals before January 16.

Farmers assembled in batches in front of the District Collector’s Office and police prevented them at the entrance and arrested them.
title: Implement High Court order, say tribal farmers
